meanings.definition: A part of a European newspaper or magazine devoted to fiction, criticism, or light literature.
meanings.sent1: The feuilleton in the newspaper always had exciting stories to read.
meanings.sent2: I enjoy reading the feuilleton section of the magazine for some light entertainment.
meanings.sent3: The feuilleton in the paper made me chuckle with its humorous stories.
meanings.sent4: Her life felt like a feuilleton, filled with drama and unexpected twists.
meanings.sent5: The feuilleton painted vivid pictures of faraway lands in my mind.

meanings.definition: A short literary composition often dealing with a single subject and published in a periodical.
meanings.sent1: The author's feuilleton on nature was beautifully written.
meanings.sent2: I look forward to reading the feuilleton about travel in the upcoming issue.
meanings.sent3: His feuilleton on cats was both informative and amusing.
meanings.sent4: Her words danced on the page in the feuilleton, captivating the readers.
meanings.sent5: The feuilleton about friendship touched my heart with its sincerity.
